Class ServerStart

java.lang.Object
ServerStart
public class ServerStart
extends java.lang.Object
This class is responsible for starting the server and to create a new thread when a client wants to communicate with the server.
It also keeps track of the users that are logged in.

    Constructors

    ServerStart()

    • addUserComms

      public static void addUserComms​(java.lang.String username, java.io.ObjectOutputStream output)
      Adds a user with the specified username and their output to a HashMap to be able to send messages directly to them.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to be added.
      output - the output to be used to send messages to this user.

    • getUserOutput

      public static java.io.ObjectOutputStream getUserOutput​(java.lang.String username)

    • addToLoggedInUsers

      public static void addToLoggedInUsers​(java.lang.String username)
      Adds a username to a HashSet of logged in users.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to be added.

    • isUserLoggedIn

      public static boolean isUserLoggedIn​(java.lang.String username)
      Check if the user specified is logged in.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to check.
      Returns:
      true if the user is logged in, false if they are not.

    • userLoggedOut

      public static void userLoggedOut​(java.lang.String username)
      Removes the user from the Set of logged in users.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to be removed.
